title: How to Make Strawberry Buttermilk Baked Doughnuts

steps.headline: Make the batter.
steps.description: Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl and thoroughly combine the wet ingredients in a separate bowl. Add the wet ingredients into the dry bowl.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into a pre-greased doughnut pan, about 2/3 full in each hole.
Bake for 12 minutes, or until golden brown.
steps.description: Allow them to cool on a cooling rack.

steps.headline: Make the icing.
steps.description: Whisk the strawberries and sugar together. Add a tablespoon of water at a time until you achieve the right consistency. You can also substitute milk for a watered-down glaze appearance.

steps.headline: Spoon the icing on top on the doughnuts.
steps.description: Leave them to rest on the cooling rack to allow the icing to set.

text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC.  Make the batter. Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl and thoroughly combine the wet ingredients in a separate bowl. Add the wet ingredients into the dry bowl. Fold in the chopped strawberries.  Pour the mixture into a pre-greased doughnut pan, about 2/3 full in each hole.  Bake for 12 minutes, or until golden brown. Allow them to cool on a cooling rack. Make the icing. Whisk the strawberries and sugar together. Add a tablespoon of water at a time until you achieve the right consistency. You can also substitute milk for a watered-down glaze appearance. Spoon the icing on top on the doughnuts. Leave them to rest on the cooling rack to allow the icing to set.
